title: Driver dies after his SUV is hit by car racing another car: Police
description: The 49-year-old man who was driving a BMW racing another car was taken to the hospital with serious injuries, Delaware State Police said.
content:
A two-car crash in Bear killed a man from Newark on Aug. 22, Delaware State Police said.

At around 3:23 p.m. on Aug. 22, a 75-year-old Newark man was driving a Chevrolet Trax SUV north on Bear Christiana Road and was in the left-turn lane at Freedom Road. A BMW 335 was traveling south at a high rate of speed while racing another car, police said.

The SUV driver began turning onto Freedom Road as the BMW 335 was approaching the same intersection, and the BMW struck the front right side of the Chevrolet, police said.

The driver of the Chevrolet went to the hospital where he died. The driver of the BMW, a 49-year-old man from Newark, was taken to the hospital with serious injuries.

Bear Christiana Road was closed for three and a half hours as a result, police said. Delaware State Police are investigating the crash, and anyone with information is encouraged to reach out to Delaware State Police or Delaware Crime Stoppers.

Shane Brennan covers Wilmington and other Delaware issues. Reach out with ideas, tips or feedback at slbrennan@delawareonline.com.

This article originally appeared on Delaware News Journal: Newark man dies after SUV hit by racing car in Bear: Police
summary: A 75-year-old Newark man died after his SUV was hit by a car racing another vehicle, according to Delaware State Police. The BMW was traveling at a high rate of speed while racing. The driver of the Chevrolet was taken to the hospital with serious injuries. The crash closed Bear Christiana Road for three and a half hours.
shortSummary: A 75-year-old Newark man died after his SUV was hit by a high-speed BMW, prompting a police investigation.

Driver dies after his SUV is hit by car racing another car: Police
A two-car crash in Bear killed a man from Newark on Aug. 22, Delaware State Police said.
At around 3:23 p.m. on Aug. 22, a 75-year-old Newark man was driving a Chevrolet Trax SUV north on Bear Christiana Road and was in the left-turn lane at Freedom Road. A BMW 335 was traveling south at a high rate of speed while racing another car, police said.
The SUV driver began turning onto Freedom Road as the BMW 335 was approaching the same intersection, and the BMW struck the front right side of the Chevrolet, police said.
The driver of the Chevrolet went to the hospital where he died. The driver of the BMW, a 49-year-old man from Newark, was taken to the hospital with serious injuries.
Bear Christiana Road was closed for three and a half hours as a result, police said. Delaware State Police are investigating the crash, and anyone with information is encouraged to reach out to Delaware State Police or Delaware Crime Stoppers.
Shane Brennan covers Wilmington and other Delaware issues. Reach out with ideas, tips or feedback at slbrennan@delawareonline.com.

argos_summary: A 75‑year‑old Newark man died after his Chevrolet Trax SUV was struck by a high‑speed BMW 335 while turning onto Freedom Road in Bear on August 22. The BMW, reportedly racing another car, hit the SUV’s front right side, leaving the SUV driver hospitalized and deceased and the BMW driver with serious injuries. Bear Christiana Road was closed for three and a half hours, and Delaware State Police are investigating the crash, urging witnesses to contact authorities.
